title_sort: marion thrasher to walt whitman, 6 december 1885
title: Marion Thrasher to Walt Whitman, 6 December 1885
text: Marion Thrasher, A. M., SUPERINTENDENT OFEDGAR PUBLIC SCHOOLS.Edgar, Neb. Dec 6th 1885Mr Walt WhitmanMy Dear Old Friend. For years, I have known you intimately, through your poems. The people of the "Great West" would like to see you—as they cannot come to you, could we not persuade you to come to them? Am known extensively over our State—as a lecturer before "Teachers Associations," and can arrange for you to give ten readings of your poems, in ten of our largest cities (you, East, would call them towns) at $50 for night—total $500.00—your expenses need not be more than $100, to and from your home here—netting you $400 for a fortnights work. You will confer the greatest favor on your many Western friends by accepting. If the Winter be too severe; could you come in the Spring—say, May? Trusting to hear favorably from you—I am—Sincerely yoursMarion ThrasherWill furnish you the highest references.Proposal for Western Course of Readings Dec. '85 | Marion Thrasher Marion Thrasher to Walt Whitman, 6 December 1885
